questions.text: Ensure that question paper is completely printed.
Students must check the course title and course code before answering the question paper. Marks UNIT I ‚Äì

a) List and Classify the different types of operators available in C language. 10 b) Design and Develop a C program to find sum and difference of two given numbers. 5 c) Illustrate a C program to print your name and address. 5 d) Build a program to find area of Triangle. 5 OR

a) Demonstrate the structure of C program with an example. 10 b) Illustrate a program to find if a number is positive or negative 5 c) Develop a C program to swap given two numbers 5 d) Construct a C program to find area of a sphere: for a given radius 5 UNIT ‚Äì II 2 4ùúãùëü

a) Make use of array concept and illustrate declaration and initialization of array with an 5 example b) Design and develop C a program to find Sum of n different number entered by the 10 user. c) Develop a program to find if a triangle is scalene. A triangle is a scalene triangle if all 10 the three sides of the triangle are not equal to each other. (Use functions) OR

a) Illustrate the working of nested if else with an example 5 b) Make use of array concept and develop a program to find Sum of composite number in 10 an array of numbers different containing numbers entered by the user. int input_array_size(); void input_array(int n, int a[n]); int sum_composite_numbers(int n, int a[n]); void out_put(int sum); c) Design and Develop a program to find gcd (hcf) of two numbers. 10 int input(); int gcd(int a, int b); void output(int a, int b, int gcd); UNIT ‚Äì III

a) Identify and illustrate operations on pointer. Develop a c program to demonstrate the 5 use of pointer. b) Summarize the basic data types associated with C and Illustrate a program to Add two 10 numbers using 4 functions and Pass by reference void input(int *a, int *b); void add(int a, int b, int *sum); void output(int a, int b, int sum); Page 1 of 2 c) Construct a program to find whether the three points form a triangle. 10 void input_triangle(float *x1, float *y1, float *x2, float *y2, float *x3, float *y3); int is_triangle(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2,float x3, float y3) void output(float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2,float x3, float y3, int istriangle) OR

a) Compare and contrast pass by value and pass by reference. 5 b) Demonstrate a program to find sum of two fractions. Write output with debugging 10 steps void input(int *num1, int *den1, int *num2, int *den2); void add(int num1,int den1, int num2, int den2, int *num3, int *den3); void output(int num1, int den1, int num2, int den2, int num3, int den3); c) Construct a program to Compare two strings 10 void input_two_string(char *a, char *b); int strcmp(char *a, char *b); void output(char *a, char *b, int result); UNIT ‚Äì IV

a) Illustrate the concept of array of structures with an example. 5 b) Demonstrate a program to find the area of a triangle. Write output with debugging 10 steps struct _triangle { float base,altitude,area; }; typedef _triangle Triangle Triangle input_triangle(); void find_area(Triangle *t); void output(Triangle t); c) Construct a program to find all the prime numbers between erotosthenes sieve 10 method. int input_array_size(); void init_array(int n, int a[n]; void erotosthenes_sieve(int n, int a[n]); void out_put(int n, int a[n]); OR

a) Distinguish between Actual and formal arguments with an example 5 b) Identify and illustrate five different library functions for string 5 c) Infer the concept of Structure in C and Illustrate the declaration of structure with an 5 example. d) Build a program to find Sum of two complex numbers 10 struct _complex { float real,imaginary; }; typedef _complex Complex Complex input_complex(); Complex add(Complex a, Complex b); void output(Complex a, Complex b, Complex c); *** Page 2 of 2 SRN 1st Semester B.Tech CSE/C&IT Semester End Examination August 2023
